page.title: 12BRIDGE OF WEIR - CONCERNS 2
page.content: The Cargill Hall Senior Citizens' Day Centre is{run}by the{Social Work {Department}and was formed in{1975.}It opens from 10 till 4.30 5 days a week. {Facilities}include a library, bingo, darts and table tennis. The{main purpose}of the centre is to get{senior citizens}out of their homes to take up{new interests}and have company. Dressmaking, arts and craft classes keep them busy.{Refreshments are available and the primary school kitchen provides meals which can be bought very{reasonably. Because{safety}is very important where{old people}are concerned,there are ramps and carpets for floors. The centre is somewhere the senior citizens can go to{talk}to each other. It also provides a{warm place in winter when it may be{expensive}to heat their own{homes.
